title: Omar_Marmoush
summary: Based on the article, Omar Marmoush is an Egyptian professional footballer who recently joined Manchester City in 2025 after successful stints with several German clubs including VfL Wolfsburg and Eintracht Frankfurt. His career trajectory shows steady progression from Egyptian club Wadi Degla through various German teams, culminating in his current role as a forward for Manchester City and the Egyptian national team.
extract: Omar Khaled Mohamed Marmoush is an Egyptian professional footballer who plays as a forward for Premier League club Manchester City and the Egypt national team.
anthropic_trending_reason: Omar Marmoush is trending because he scored a remarkable first-half hat-trick in Manchester City's dominant 4-0 victory over Newcastle United at the Etihad Stadium. The Egyptian forward's exceptional performance helped Manchester City look like their formidable selves again under Pep Guardiola, with his three goals coming in quick succession to give City a commanding 3-0 lead before halftime.
openai_trending_reason: Omar_Marmoush is trending because of his recent performance and signing with Manchester City, generating buzz among fans and analysts alike. His involvement with the Egypt national team has also captured attention, especially leading up to upcoming international fixtures.

'''Omar Khaled Mohamed Marmoush''' ({{langx|ar|عمر خالد محمد مرموش}};<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.masress.com/youm7/5614439 |title=الثامنة يا أبطال.. عمر مرموش الموهبة الصاعدة فى كتيبة |trans-title=Eighth, O heroes.. Omar Marmoush, the rising talent in the battalion |website=Masress |date=11 January 2022 |access-date=18 February 2025 |language=ar}}</ref> born 7 February 1999) is an Egyptian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Egypt national football team|Egypt national team]].

==Club career==
===Wadi Degla===
Marmoush made his professional debut for [[Wadi Degla SC|Wadi Degla]] in the [[Egyptian Premier League]] on 8 July 2016, coming on as a substitute in the match against [[Al Ittihad Alexandria Club]], which finished as a 3–2 win. In total, he made sixteen league appearances for Wadi Degla and scored two goals, before moving to [[VfL Wolfsburg II]] in 2017.<ref name="Wadi">{{cite news |last=Al-Awadi |first=Hani |url=https://www.filgoal.com/articles/361300 |title=حوار في الجول – عمر مرموش يوضح لماذا فضل فولفسبورج على دورتموند.. وكيف تألق مع دجلة |trans-title=Conversation with FilGoal – Omar Marmoush explains why he favoured Wolfsburg over Dortmund... and how he starred with Degla |website=FilGoal.com |date=11 April 2019 |access-date=16 May 2020 |language=ar}}</ref>

=== VfL Wolfsburg===
On 26 May 2020, Marmoush made his professional debut for Wolfsburg in their 4–1 [[Bundesliga]] win over [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] at the [[BayArena]]. Marmoush signed his first professional contract for the club on 23 June. On 5 August 2020, he made his European debut in a 3–0 defeat (5–1 aggregate) against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]] round of 16. Marmoush returned to Wolfsburg after his breakthrough Bundesliga season with Stuttgart.{{citation needed|date=February 2025}}

On 5 January 2021, Marmoush was loaned to [[FC St. Pauli]] for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.vfl-wolfsburg.de/en/news-detail/news-detail/detail/news/loaned-to-st-pauli/|title=Loaned to St. Pauli|publisher=VfL Wolfsburg|date=5 January 2021|access-date=5 January 2021}}</ref> He played 21 games and scored seven goals for the club.{{citation needed|date=February 2025}}

On 30 August 2021, Marmoush was loaned out to [[VfB Stuttgart]] until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vfb.de/en/vfb/latest/news/profes

title: Samantha_Barks
summary: This article is about Samantha Barks, a Manx actress and singer born in 1990, who gained fame after placing third in BBC's "I'd Do Anything" in 2008. She is notably known for her role as Éponine in the 2012 film "Les Misérables," has appeared in various stage productions including "Pretty Woman: The Musical" and "Frozen" in London's West End, and has released three studio albums throughout her career.
extract: Samantha Jane Barks is a Manx actress and singer who rose to fame after placing third in the BBC talent show-themed television series I'd Do Anything in 2008. She has released three studio albums: Looking in Your Eyes (2007), Samantha Barks (2016), and Into the Unknown (2021).
anthropic_trending_reason: Samantha Barks is trending because she was recently crowned the winner of The Masked Singer UK 2025, where she performed as the character Pufferfish. The West End and screen actress's victory has generated additional buzz as she's set to perform a solo concert at the prestigious London Palladium in April, though her win has apparently sparked some backlash that she's had to address on social media.
openai_trending_reason: Samantha Barks is trending because of the recent release of her latest album, *Into the Unknown*, which has garnered significant attention from fans and music critics alike. Additionally, her popularity is fueled by her participation in various promotional events and interviews that showcase her talent and career achievements.
